intro: Pourthiaea amphidoxa var. amphidoxa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. The species is known for its adaptability to indoor conditions and its ability to thrive in low-light settings.
